benchmark_details.name: Uhura
benchmark_details.overview: Uhura is a new benchmark designed to evaluate LMsâ€™ scientific knowledge and truthfulness in six low-resource African languages, consisting of two tasks: Uhura-ARC-Easy (multiple-choice science questions) and Uhura-TruthfulQA (evaluating truthfulness on various topics).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of language models on scientific knowledge and truthfulness in low-resource African languages.

data.source: The dataset was created via human translation of established benchmarks (ARC-Easy and TruthfulQA).
data.size: Approximately 1,200 questions per language for ARC-Easy and up to 817 questions for TruthfulQA.
data.annotation: Translations were conducted by professional translators, with quality control by language coordinators.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correctly answered questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of language models in understanding and responding to questions in low-resource African languages.
methodology.baseline_results: Closed models consistently outperformed open models, with specific accuracies reported in the evaluation results.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personal identifying information is included in the datasets.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The Uhura benchmark datasets are released under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0) license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All translators provided informed consent for their involvement.
